§Plugins

Seneca plugins enable you to build awesome microservices, incredibly fast. Some plugins are maintained in-house, while others are provided by the community.

On this page, we provide an npm link and total downloads per month for any plugins we find or publish ourselves, so you only need to look in one place.

Table of contents:

  • This intro about the plugins
  • Block list of families with description, link to full description block
  • Each family name with full description, followed by block-list of each plugin in family (with short description)
  • Subheadings of each family with short description
  • Each plugin with badges and description (links active)
  • ‘Got a plugin to share?’ section

§Family Descriptions

§cache

cache. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

cache
In-memory caching plugin for seneca
cache-test
Standard test cases for seneca caches
entity-cache
Versioned caching plugin for seneca
memcached-cache
memcached plugin for seneca
redis-cache
Redis caching plugin for seneca

§entity

entity. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

entity
Entity plugin for seneca
entity-depend
entity-history
entity-rtag
Adds a random tag to entities on each save, allowing for various caching strategies.
entity-util
Collection of optional utilities for Seneca entities.

§gateway

gateway. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

gateway
Handle incoming messages within other frameworks.
gateway-auth
Authentication support for @seneca/gateway plugins
gateway-express-auth
Provide authentication for the @seneca/gateway-express plugin.
gateway-express
Handle incoming messages within express, defining an endpoint that accepts Seneca messages.
gateway-lambda
Handle incoming messages within AWS Lambdas.

§msg

msg. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

msg-run
msg-test
Structured testing of seneca plugin messages.

§redis

redis. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

redis-queue-transport
Seneca Redis Queue Transport
redis-store
Redis storage layer for Seneca framework
redis-kv
Seneca plugin providing messages for a redis key-value store.

§search

search. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

search-mini

§telemetry

telemetry. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

telemetry-datadog
undefined
telemetry-newrelic
Handle incoming messages within other frameworks.
user-telemetry
A Seneca plugin that provides basic user telemetry operations.

§transport

transport. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

transport
Seneca transport
transport-test
Standard test cases for Seneca transports.
amqp-transport
Official AMQP transport plugin for Seneca
beanstalk-transport
Seneca beanstalk transport
sns-transport
Seneca transport for AWS SNS

§user

user. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

user
User management plugin for Seneca

§web

web. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

web
Http route mapping for Seneca microservices.
web-adapter-connect
seneca-web adapter for connect
web-adapter-express
seneca-web adapter for express
web-adapter-hapi
seneca-web adapter for hapi
web-adapter-koa
seneca-web adapter for koa web framework (v1)

§logger

logger. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

logentries-logger
Seneca Logentries Logger
logstash-logger
pino-logger
Pino logger plugin for Seneca

provider. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

branchio-provider
Seneca entity provider for the Branchio API.

Handle incoming messages within other frameworks.
evervault-provider
Seneca entity provider for the Evervault API.
github-provider
Handle incoming messages within other frameworks.
mixpanel-provider
Seneca entity provider for the Mixpanel API.
nordigen-provider
Handle incoming messages within other frameworks.
tangocard-provider
Seneca entity provider for the Tangocard API.
trello-provider
Seneca entity provider for the Trello API.
vercel-provider
Seneca entity provider for the Vercel API.

§store

store. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

jsonfile-store
Seneca data store plugin that uses plain JSON files
mem-store
Seneca in-memory data storage plugin.
mongo-store
Seneca data store plugin for MongoDB
mysql-store
MySQL database layer for Seneca framework
postgres-store
Seneca data store plugin for PostgreSQL
sqlite-store
SQLite database layer for Seneca framework

§test

test. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

error-test
Seneca error test.
store-test
Standard test cases for seneca stores
test-plugin
Test Seneca plugin.

§registry

registry. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

registry
Seneca service registry (simplistic single instance).
consul-registry
Seneca key value registry for Consul.

§XXX

various. This will be a longer description eventually, giving background on what this family of plugins could be used for, and how to use them.

flame
Handle incoming messages within other frameworks.
debug
Seneca plugin for debugging Seneca-based systems.
basic
Seneca utility plugin.
ledger
Ledger business logic plugin for the Seneca platform.
maintain
Run maintenance tests for Seneca plugins.
request
Outbound Web Request Plugin for Seneca
mail
Seneca email plugin
balance-client
Seneca client-side load balancing transport.
graph
A Seneca plugin that provides basic graph operations.
repl
Provides a client and server REPL for Seneca microservice systems.
refer
User Referral business logic plugin for the Seneca platform.
browser
Seneca for the browser.
flow
Workflow operations and data model.
vote
env
Handle incoming messages within other frameworks.
allow
Allow messages to proceed if they meet certain criteria
apikey
Apikey management plugin for Seneca
joi
Seneca plugin that provides joi message validation.
kv
Seneca plugin providing messages for a generic key-value store.
log-filter
Seneca log filtering module
auth
User authentication plugin for the seneca module.
parambulator
Seneca plugin that provides parambulator message validation.
config
doc
Documentation helper for Seneca plugins.
group
Seneca plugin for user and group permissions.
hapi
Seneca plugin for hapi-based systems.
external
Handle external Seneca messages safely.
populate
Seneca plugin for user and populate permissions.
monitor
seneca-monitor
owner
Seneca plugin to add user ownership annotations to entities.
promisify
Seneca plugin for user and promisify permissions.
member
Seneca plugin for generic membership.
sendgrid-mail
Seneca SendGrid email plugin
srv-admin
Service administration

§Got a plugin to share?

Our docs are open source. Simply fork the senecajs.org repository, add your plugin to the appropriate section, and send us on a pull request - that way, other people can find your awesome plugin easily.

Issues? From spelling errors to broken tutorials and everything in between, report them here.
